comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
It's a common enough problem to forget to clone recursively - so I'd add:

If you have already cloned but forgot to use `--recursive`, then you can run:

``` sh
git submodule update --init
```

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: As this is also covered in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/powershell-repository-101.md, why don't we move those instructions into a separate document and use INCLUDE statement?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: I think there is no harm in having duplication there.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @alexandair it needs to be covered here because it is very important information that you don't want devs to hunt for. A new dev should have to read two documents to build: the readme and the build instructions.

title: added "recursive cloning" back to readme per request #1197
